alert.note: Alert for San Mateo (California) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 22 at 9:22AM PDT until further notice by NWS Monterey
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1245 PM PDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Small stream flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northern California, including the following county, San Mateo. * WHEN...Until 1245 PM PDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Streams continue to rise due to excess runoff from earlier rainfall. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 918 AM PDT, Doppler radar and automated rain gauges indicated heavy rain over southern San Mateo County. Flooding along the Pilarcitos Creek is continuing, and additional flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly in the warned area. - Additional rainfall amounts of 0.25 to 0.75 inches are possible in the warned area. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Half Moon Bay. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Be especially cautious at night when it is harder to recognize the dangers of flooding.
